data.title: Upgrade to atom-shell v0.20.7
Patch not replacing file associations (Windows 8.1 x64)
data.body: Whenever Atom updates, opening a file associated with Atom will open only the old version. The updated Atom is in a different folder, and I have to delete the old folder and re-associate. Is there a way to fix this, and delete the previous installation of Atom after an update?

data.title: Make waitsForPromise() work with es6 promises as well as Q promises
Add optional package-name argument to run-specs grunt task
data.body: This way we can do `grunt run-specs:markdown-preview` to debug a single package's specs on CI.

data.title: workspaceView.eachEditorView does not seem to subscribe to future views
data.body:
Mac OS X 10.10.1
Atom 0.172.0

I have some extremely basic code to subscribe to current and future WorkspaceViews:

```
atom.workspaceView.eachEditorView (editorView) ->
  console.log ' ------> editorView handler!'
```

This has worked in previous versions of my package, but in 0.172.0, I get a single log statement when Atom opens (if I have an open editor view), then no future log statements in the console as editor views are opened. I've tried moving these 2 lines of code around in my package to figure out whether there was perhaps a silent error somewhere, but no luck. Also, no errors in the console whatsoever. Any ideas?

Cheers

data.title: A markdown-preview spec is flaky
Select menu flashes white when opening and closing in settings-view (Linux and Windows)
data.body:
(I'm opening this here instead of in [settings-view](https://github.com/atom/settings-view) because I suspect this is a bigger issue than just settings-view.)

**OS:** Ubuntu 14.04.1 LTS
**Atom:** 0.175.0

Whenever you you open or close a `select` in Settings it briefly flashes white, which can be kind of jarring. I've never experienced this on my Mac running Yosemite, so I suspect it's a Linux issue (which I can find out for sure when I go home and test on my VMs). This happens regardless of theme and in safe mode as well.

![screencast](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/823545/5865577/896c8a62-a258-11e4-9024-b950627cea1e.gif)

data.title: Add about the team page to atom.io
data.body:
I would like to see an "about us" page on atom.io.  It should have a photo and short bio for every core team member along with primary responsibilities.  Many consider these public relations junk but I for one would like to see faces on the people that have such a big impact on Atom.  I think this would put a human face on the project and make it more welcoming.

Also a brief history of Atom, motivation for creating Atom, and a vision for the future would be nice.

Normally on an open-source project it would be hard to pick out contributors to be considered "core" but here it would be any github employee assigned to Atom.

data.title: Can not open atom from command line
data.body:
When I try to open atom from the command line using: atom .
I get this error
FSPathMakeRef(/Applications/Atom.app) failed with error -43.

I reinstalled the shell commands, closed and opened Atom, closed and opened the command prompt and the error still persists.

data.title: Add the ability to file an issue for deprecated selectors
data.body: Deprecated Javascript APIs have an awesome ability to just file a bug for them automatically, it'd be great if that were also possible for deprecated selectors.

data.title: Bundle the one themes
data.body: Start shipping these new themes

data.title: Package config schemas aren't used at startup
data.body:
- With Atom closed, add the following to your `~/.atom/config.cson` file:

``` coffee
'markdown-preview':
  liveUpdate: 4
```
- Open Atom
- Run `atom.config.get('markdown-preview.liveUpdate')` from the Console
- `4` is printed out

This schema for this package states this key path should be a boolean, https://github.com/atom/markdown-preview/blob/dfc0f9617dc42885ec719134931c78293d275524/lib/main.coffee#L26-L28 but no validation error is logged at startup.

data.title: Using "Show in Explorer" command on a folder in the treeview does not show the complete folder path on Windows
data.body:
Description : It is not possible to navigate easly in the windows explorer when using the "Open in explorer" command in the Atom Tree view on Windows.

To test : 
Create a folder with a text file in it.
Right click > Open with Atom
In the tree view, click on "Open in explorer"
http://i.imgur.com/NUNUBYA.png

_To compare, click on the path at the top of the window that just opened, and copy & past it into a new window explorer_

You can see from the following image that the explorer that Atom opened (left one in the printscreen) does not show all the path and that you can not click on the previous button either.

http://i.imgur.com/tbe0n8y.png

Because of that behavior, it is difficult to navigate in windows that Atom opens.

data.title: [Gutter] Implement API for Creating Custom Gutters
Range.isSingleLine should be named isSingleRow for consistency?
data.body:
It seems all of the other methods on Range refer to lines as rows, at least in the published interface:

https://atom.io/docs/api/v0.175.0/Range

data.title: close tab 'x' button missing after upgrade to 0.175.0
data.body:
After upgrading to atom 0.175.0 this morning, the `x` button is no longer present in the tab header (on hover or otherwise). Looking in the inspector, the `close-icon` div is present, but nothing is inside it, nor is any CSS rule causing an 'x' to be rendered. ```
  • app-main.js
    • ``` I am running Ubuntu 14.04.

data.title: Folder search result is not displayed
data.body:
Although a Message (x) Results present is shown the search results are not shown. This is after the latest update. 
![atom bug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/350933/5858626/a9604738-a27a-11e4-9cb3-e6b0d0432e99.PNG)

data.title: Packages not finding updates
data.body:
### Versions

**Atom:** 0.176.0-f7ecc3e
**OS:** Ubuntu 14.04
**settings-view:** 0.174.0

When going to the "Updates" section of "Settings", it says "All of your installed packages are up to date!". I have friends who are seeing packages updating. They are running previous versions of Atom ~0.173.0 on Linux. I also know for a fact there are updates, ie: `Linter` my current version is `0.10.0` and the newest version is `0.10.1`. I'm not sure what happened or when, but I have not received any updates for a few days now at least.

Issue still occurs when attempting `atom --safe` and `sudo atom`

data.title: restart and install update restarts lost 1 window
data.body:
I used the install and update button,

(but I did not know I was already in the latest version, so this should not have been available I guess)

I had 2 Atom windows open,
1 reopened well,
The second reopened showing the folder app-0.174.0 with the DLL inside
![untitled](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/536398/5856748/3a931058-a246-11e4-9f50-46ae6cd80e6c.png)
And I'm still in 0.174.0 (which is normal)

data.title: Can't update plugins
data.body:
Hi,

I'm using Atom on Windows 8 and I can't update plugins anymore. Always getting the error, that npm isn't in the environment variable. It all worked before without errors (okay, I can't update Emmet since 3 weeks or so).

Did anyone already posted a possible fix or does anyone have an idea how to solve this kinda ugly bug/problem?

:sos:

data.title: 'Save changes' dialogue key bindings
data.body:
> 'untitled' has changes, do you want to save them?
> Your changes will be lost if you close this item without saving
> [Save] [Cancel] [Don't save]

Would be great to be able to close this dialogue, using keyboard, like this:
- <kbd>Alt+S</kbd> for '**S**ave'
- <kbd>Alt+C</kbd> for '**C**ancel'
- <kbd>Alt+D</kbd> for '**D**on't save'

---

Atom `0.174.0` on GNU Operating System

data.title: Alt + F and Alt +H not working to open menu on windows
data.body:
hello

I often use my keyboard to access menus of the editor,
I installed atom yesterday and like it, thank you!

But I doscovered this morning that I can't open menus on Windows 8.1 using the shortcuts Alt+H and Alt +F.
stangely the other menus work fine (find, edit, packages and selection)

data.title: Bundle Git with Atom
data.body: I feel like Atom should come with everything needed to make it work. This includes Git for installing packages (arguably the most important feature of Atom). When you try to install a package without Git, it throws a pretty useless and confusing error. I think Atom should check to see if Git is installed, and if not, prompt the user to install it along side Atom.
